BOOLEAN SmsHandler::ChangePreferredStorageMedia (  Sms::StorageType  storagetype  ) 
 

changes the prefered storage media for storing SMS

BOOLEAN SmsHandler::EnableResendingSmsOverCs (  UINT32  timer  ) 
 

If sending SMS over GPRS fails, then the MS has the possibilty to resend the SMS over CS for an implementation dependent time.

Parameters:
timer specifies, in milli seconds, how long resending over CS will be implementated before switching the service to CS. If <= 0 no SMS resending will be performed.
Returns:
true if the stack support resending over CS.

SmsMoreMessageType SmsHandler::QuerySmsMoreMessageType (   ) 
 

Query the stack for the SmsMoreMessage status which is currently set.

Sms::Result SmsHandler::SendSms (  Tpdu &  tpdu,
BOOLEAN  wait_for_response = TRUE,
GsmService  service = CircuitSwitched
) 
 

In the blocking-mode(wait_for_response = TRUE), there is only the Sms::Result as return parameter available. No further parameters, like the assigned reference-number or the short-message-failure-cause, are reported. These parameters will be available in the asynchronous-mode(wait_for_response = FALSE), by listening to the confirmation and rejection message. The parameter service defines the service, which is used for sending the Tpdu.

BOOLEAN SmsHandler::SetMessageWaitIndicators (  const MdhSetWaitIndicatorArray &  wia  ) 
 

Set the wait indicators for message indications.

void SmsHandler::SetSendingResult (  Tpdu &  tpdu,
Sms::Result  result,
const SmsReferenceNumber &  reference_number = 0xFF
) 
 

is used for non-blocking send method (Send(tpdu, FALSE)), to update the state of the SMS.

BOOLEAN SmsHandler::SetSmsMoreMessageType (  const SmsMoreMessageType &  type  ) 
 

Controls the more message send feature inside the stack, this means the radio link remains open after sending the subsequent TPDUs. SmsMoreMessageType is an eumeration which might have the following values: SmsDisableMoreMessages, SmsEnableMoreMessages, SmsEnableMoreMessagesUntilTimerExpiry.

Sms::Result SmsHandler::StoreSms (  const Tpdu &  tpdu  )  const
 

stores the Sms on the preferred storage media and returns if the store-request was successful. ADC methods SetInitialPrefferedStorageMedia and ChangePreferredStorageMedia of DataHandler shall be used to control where MT-SMS and MO-SMS shall be stored.

Sms::Result SmsHandler::StoreSms (  const Tpdu &  tpdu,
const Sms::StorageType  storage_type
)  const
 

stores SMS on SIM or Flash and returns if the store-request was successful.
